content: HONG KONG (Reuters Breakingviews) - Stock-market investors have sent a love letter to China's FedEx. A rally in the newly listed firm behind SF Express makes boss Wang Wei one of China's richest men. At roughly $40 billion  his company is now worth nearly as much as Deutsche Post. That looks like an overreaction  driven by hype over e-commerce and a shortage of tradable shares.
name: FedEx Corporation
title: Market delivers crazy love letter to China's FedEx

content: NEW YORK  April 1 FedEx Corp must face a second lawsuit claiming it shipped thousands of cartons of untaxed cigarettes in New York over roughly a decade  cheating the state and New York City out of tax revenue and undercutting their efforts to curb smoking.
